text: The National Solidarity Party (, PSN) was a political party in Portugal. ==History== The party was established in 1990 and sought to represent the interests of pensioners.Partido da Solidariedade Nacional CNE In the 1991 parliamentary elections it received 1.68% of the vote and won a seat in the Assembly of the Republic,Dieter Nohlen & Philip Stöver (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, p1554–1559 taken by its president, Manuel Sérgio. However, its vote share was reduced to just 0.21% in the 1995 elections, resulting in the party losing its seat. The 1999 elections saw the party's vote share remain at 0.21%. After failing to regain parliamentary representation, it did not contest any further elections, and was declared defunct in 2006. The party also contested the elections for the European Parliament in 1994 and 1999, winning no seats in both cases. ==Election results== ===Assembly of the Republic=== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; font-size:85%; line-height:14px;" |- ! rowspan="2" width="50px"| Election ! colspan="5"| Assembly of the Republic ! rowspan="2" width="125px"| Government ! rowspan="2" width="40px"| Size ! rowspan="2" width="330px"| Notes |- ! width="85px"| Votes ! width="50px"| % ! width="40px"| ±pp ! width="100px"| Seats won ! width="40px"| +/− |- ! 1991 | 96,096 | 1.68% | 1.68 | | 1 | style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| Opposition | 5th | New party |- ! 1995 | 12,613 | 0.21% | 1.47 | | 1 | style="background-color:#FFFFFF"| Out of parliament | 8th | align="left"| |- ! 1999 | 11,488 | 0.21% | 0.0 | | 0 | tyle="background-color:#FFFFFF"| Out of parliament | 9th | align="left"| |- |} ===European Parliament=== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font- size:85%; line-height:14px;" |- ! rowspan="2" width="50px"| Election ! colspan="5"| European Parliament ! rowspan="2" width="40px"| Size ! rowspan="2" width="330px"| Notes |- ! width="85px"| Votes ! width="50px"| % ! width="40px"| ±pp ! width="100px"| Seats won ! width="40px"| +/ |- ! 1994 | 11,214 | 0.37% | 0.37 | | 0 | 10th | New party |- ! 1999 | 8,413 | 0.24% | 0.13 | | 0 | 9th | align="left"| |} ==References== Category:Defunct political parties in Portugal Category:Political parties established in 1990 Category:Political parties disestablished in 2006 Category:1990 establishments in Portugal Category:2006 disestablishments in Portugal Category:Pensioners' parties
title: National Solidarity Party (Portugal)
